alert.note: Alert for Boone; Carroll; Gallatin; Grant; Owen (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:12PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SWITZERLAND, EASTERN CARROLL, SOUTHERN BOONE, NORTHWESTERN GRANT, NORTH CENTRAL OWEN AND GALLATIN COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 612 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Florence, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Williamstown, Walton, Crittenden, Dry Ridge, Warsaw, Florence, Kentucky Speedway, Glencoe, Sparta, Patriot, Ryle, Interstate 71 at Mile Marker 52, Big Bone Lick, Interstate 71 at US Route 127, Steele Bottom, Markland, Beaverlick, Quercus Grove, Egypt Bottom and US Route 42 at State Route 184. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Kentucky between mile markers 52 and 76. I-75 in Kentucky near mile marker 173. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...and northern Kentucky. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
